Sense.DEF: the 24th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十四个字母

Sense.DEF: the number 10 in the system of roman numerals
a letter used in mathematics to represent an unknown quantity or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: if 3x = 6, x = 2
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 若 3x=6﹐则 x=2

Sense.DEF: a mark used on school work to show that a written answer is not correct
Sense.TRAN: 叉号 〔表示书面答案错误的符号〕

Sense.DEF: a mark used to show that you have chosen something on an official piece of paper, for example when voting
Sense.TRAN: 叉号〔表示选中的符号﹐如用于投票时〕

Sense.DEF: a mark used to show a kiss, especially at the end of a letter
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示亲吻的符号﹐尤用于信末〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Love, Cindy XXX
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱你的辛迪﹐吻你

Sense.DEF: used in the past to describe a film that was officially approved as only suitable for people over 18
Sense.TRAN: X 级〔过去使用的电影级别﹐表示未满18岁者不宜观看〕

Sense.DEF: a letter used instead of someone’s or something’s real name because you want to keep it secret or you do not know it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以代替不宜公开或不知其名的人或事物的名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the trial, Ms X said that she had known the defendant for three years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在审判中﹐X 女士说她认识被告已有三年。

Sense.DEF: a mark used instead of a signature by someone who cannot write
Sense.TRAN: 〔不会写字的人用以代替签名的〕X 记号﹐画押

Sense.DEF: used to say that there are a number of people or things when the exact number is not important
Sense.TRAN: 若干个人/物〔用于说明有一些人或物﹐而准确的数字并不重要〕

Sense.DEF: used on maps in adventure stories to show that something is buried in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: X 标示该地点〔用于探险故事的地图上﹐指某物埋在某地〕

Sense.DEF: to mark or remove a mistake in a piece of writing using an X
Sense.TRAN: 〔在文章中〕用X符号标出[删去]〔错误〕

Sense.DEF: the line marked with numbers or times that goes from left to right on a graph
an X-certificate film is one that people under 18 are not allowed to see in Britain because it contains sex or violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影〕X 级的﹔X 级片〔含有性或暴力内容﹐在英国未满18岁者禁止观看〕

Sense.DEF: a type of chromosome that exists in pairs in female cells, and together with a y chromosome in male cells
a colourless gas that is found in very small quantities in the air. It is a chemical element: symbol Xe
Sense.TRAN: 氙〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Xe〕

Sense.DEF: strong fear or dislike of people from other countries
Sense.TRAN: 惧外心理﹐仇外心理〔对外国人的强烈恐惧或憎恨〕

Sense.DEF: the operation of putting an organ from an animal into a person’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors in Mississippi performed the world’s first heart xenotransplant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 密西西比的医生进行了世界首例异种心脏移植手术。

Sense.DEF: the organ that is moved in a xenotransplant operation
Sense.TRAN: 〔在异种器官移植手术中〕被移植的动物器官

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 异种器官移植涉及的健康风险

Sense.DEF: used on clothes to show their size
Sense.TRAN: 特大号〔表示服装尺寸的标记〕

Sense.DEF: a word that means Christmas, often written on signs or cards
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞节〔常写于标牌或贺卡上〕

Sense.DEF: a way of writing a document on a computer so that its structure is clear, and so that it can easily be read on a different computer system
Sense.TRAN: 可扩展置标语言﹐可扩展标记语言〔计算机文件的一种编写格式﹐结构清晰﹐并且在不同计算机系统上也容易读取〕

Sense.DEF: an X-rated film is one that people under 18 are not allowed to see because it includes sex or violence
Sense.TRAN: X级的〔指电影含有性或暴力内容﹐未满18岁者禁止观看〕

Sense.DEF: a beam of radiation1 that can go through solid objects and is used for photographing the inside of the body
a photograph of part of someone’s body, taken using X-rays to see if anything is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The X-ray showed that her leg was not broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: X光片显示她的腿没有骨折。

Sense.DEF: a medical examination made using X-rays
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to go to hospital for an X-ray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不去医院做X光检查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chest X-ray
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胸部X光检查

Sense.DEF: to photograph the inside of someone’s body using X-rays
Sense.EXAMPLE: The problem was only discovered when her lungs were X-rayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的肺部照了X光后才发现有问题。

Sense.DEF: a musical instrument which consists of metal or wooden bars of different lengths that you hit with a special stick
the 25th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十五个字母

Sense.DEF: full of something or covered with something
Sense.EXAMPLE: sugary desserts full of sugar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含糖的甜点
Sense.EXAMPLE: dirty hands covered with dirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏手
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hairy chest covered with hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多毛的胸部

Sense.DEF: having a quality or feeling, or tending to do something
Sense.TRAN: 有…特质[感情]的﹔有…倾向的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a messy room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乱糟糟的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: curly hair hair that curls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鬈发
Sense.EXAMPLE: feeling sleepy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感到昏昏欲睡的

Sense.DEF: like or typical of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cold wintry day typical of winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 寒冷的冬日
Sense.EXAMPLE: his long, horsy face he looks like a horse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那长长的马脸

Sense.DEF: fond of or interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a horsy woman who likes riding horses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜欢骑马的女人

Sense.DEF: used to make a word or name less formal, and often to show that you care about them – used especially when talking to children
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于对儿童说话时﹐常表示喜欢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s little Johnny?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小约翰尼哪儿去了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: my daddy my father
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的爸爸
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a nice doggy dog!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多可爱的狗狗啊！

Sense.DEF: used to make nouns from some verbs to show an action
Sense.TRAN: 〔置于一些动词后构成名词〕…动作﹐…行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: the expiry date the date when something expires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到期日
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inquiry the act of inquiring about something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次调查

Sense.DEF: you
Sense.EXAMPLE: See ya later!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回头见！

Sense.DEF: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于游玩或运动﹐尤指可以住宿的〕大游艇﹐大型帆船

Sense.DEF: sailing, travelling, or racing in a yacht
Sense.TRAN: 驾驶游艇[帆船]﹔驾艇旅游﹔(进行)帆船比赛

Sense.DEF: a man who sails a yacht
a woman who sails a yacht
said when you do not want to give a lot of detailed information, because it is boring or because the person you are talking to already knows it
Sense.TRAN: 诸如此类﹐等等〔表示具体说话内容的省略〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I started talking to her and – yada yada yada – it turns out she’s from New York too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始和她聊起来﹐说呀说的﹐最后发现原来她也是从纽约来的。

Sense.DEF: shouted when you are very happy or excited about something
Sense.TRAN: 呀﹐哇﹐嗬嗬〔表示快乐或激动〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is rough, noisy, or rude
Sense.TRAN: 粗人﹔吵闹的人﹔粗鲁的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of time-wasting yahoos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帮无所事事的粗人

Sense.DEF: a Hebrew name for God
Sense.TRAN: 耶和华〔希伯来语中对上帝的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: an animal of central Asia that looks like a cow with long hair
Sense.TRAN: 牦牛〔产于中亚﹐外形似牛﹐有长毛〕

Sense.DEF: to talk continuously about things that are not very serious, in a way that is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 喋喋不休地讲﹐唠叨﹔瞎扯

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘all of you’, used mainly in the southern US states when speaking to more than one person
Sense.TRAN: 你们大伙﹐你们全都〔主要用于美国南部〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going home now. See y’all later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在要回家了﹐大家再见。

Sense.DEF: a tropical climbing plant grown for its root, which is eaten as a vegetable
a type of sweet potato
to talk continuously in a way that is annoying
Sense.TRAN: 〔不停地〕哇啦哇啦地大声说话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crowd of yammering aunts and cousins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群哇啦哇啦说个不停的姑婶和表亲

Sense.DEF: the male principle in Chinese philosophy which is active, light, and positive, and which combines with yinthe female principle to influence everything in the world
to suddenly pull something quickly and with force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the men grabbed Tom’s hair and yanked his head back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一名男子抓住汤姆的头发把他的头往后一拽。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick yanked the door open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克猛地拉开门。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With both hands she yanked at the necklace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她双手猛扯项链。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He gave the rope a yank.

Sense.DEF: an American – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 美国人﹐美国佬〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a soldier who fought on the side of the Union the northern states during the American Civil War
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国南北战争期间的〕北军士兵

Sense.DEF: someone born in or living in the northern states of the US – sometimes used in an insulting way by people from the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 北方人﹐北方佬〔指在美国北方诸州出生或生活的人﹐有时被南方人用作蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: an American – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 美国人﹐美国佬〔常含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: someone from New England
if a small dog yaps, it barksmakes short loud sounds in an excited way
to talk in a noisy and annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 哇啦哇啦地说个不停﹔瞎扯
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some guy was yapping on his cell phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个家伙在哇啦哇啦地打手机。

Sense.DEF: the sound a small dog makes when it yaps
a unit for measuring length, equal to three feet or 0.91 metres
Sense.TRAN: 码〔长度单位﹐等于3英尺或0.91米〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hundred yards away
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 100码外
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area of 9,000 square yards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面积为9,000平方码的一片区域

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area next to a building or group of buildings, used for a special purpose, activity, or business
Sense.TRAN: 〔专门用途﹑活动或事务的〕场所﹔围场﹔场地
Sense.EXAMPLE: a builder’s yard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑工地
Sense.EXAMPLE: a timber yard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 木场

GramExa.GLOSS: an area outside a prison or school where prisoners or students do activities outdoors

Sense.DEF: the area around a house, usually covered with grass
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子周围通常种满草的〕庭院

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids were playing in the back yard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在后院玩耍。

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area without grass at the back of a small house
an informal name for Scotland Yard
Sense.TRAN: 苏格兰场〔Scotland Yard 的非正式名称〕

Sense.DEF: the number of yards that a team or player moves forward in a game of American football
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球中〕将球向前推进的码数

Sense.DEF: the size of something measured in yards or square yards
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large yardage of sail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大幅船帆

Sense.DEF: one of the ends of the pole that supports a square sail
someone who is in prison, especially for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指入狱很久的〕囚犯﹔监狱老鸟

Sense.DEF: a sale of used clothes and things from someone’s house which takes place in their yard
Sense.TRAN: 〔在自家院子进行的〕庭院旧货出售

Sense.DEF: something that you compare another thing with, in order to judge how good or successful it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profit is the most important yardstick of success for any business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润是衡量任何企业成功与否的最重要标杆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These subjects are used as a yardstick against which to measure the children’s progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学科被用作衡量孩子学习进步的标尺。

Sense.DEF: a special stick used for measuring things, which is exactly one yard long
a small circular cap worn by some Jewish men
Sense.TRAN: 亚莫克便帽〔一些犹太男子戴的小圆帽〕

Sense.DEF: thick thread made of cotton or wool, which is used to knit things
a story of adventures, travels etc, usually made more exciting and interesting by adding things that never really happened
Sense.TRAN: 奇谈﹐奇闻轶事﹔历险故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old captain would often spin tell us a yarn about life aboard ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老船长经常会给我们讲一些船上生活的奇闻轶事。

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth that Muslim women wear across their faces in public
Sense.TRAN: 〔女穆斯林在公共场合戴的〕面纱

Sense.DEF: if a ship, aircraft etc yaws, it turns away from the direction it should be travelling in
to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alan stretched and yawned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦伸伸懒腰﹐打了个呵欠。

Sense.DEF: a very large difference between two groups, things, or people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the yawning gap between the two parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个党派之间的鸿沟
Sense.EXAMPLE: the yawning gulf between the rich and the poor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的贫富差距

Sense.DEF: to be or become wide open, especially in a frightening way
Sense.TRAN: 张得很开﹔〔尤指令人恐惧地〕豁开
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pit yawned open in front of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那深坑张着大口呈现在他们面前。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the yawning gap between the two cliffs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两座悬崖之间的巨大豁口

Sense.DEF: an act of yawning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kay shook her head and stifled a yawn tried to stop yawning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯摇摇头﹐忍住呵欠。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is boring
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was a big yawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次聚会无聊透了。

Sense.DEF: a tropical skin disease
Sense.TRAN: 雅司病〔一种热带皮肤病〕

Sense.DEF: the line marked with numbers that goes from top to bottom on a graph
said when you are very happy about something
the part of a gene that makes someone a male instead of a female

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= yard or yards 码

Sense.DEF: you – used especially when speaking to more than one person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abandon hope all ye who enter here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汝等踏入此地之人﹐舍弃希望吧。

Sense.DEF: the – used in the names of shops and pubs to make them seem old
Sense.TRAN: 〔相当于the﹐用于商号或酒吧名称中﹐以示其历史悠久〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ye Olde Antique Shoppe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老古玩店

Sense.DEF: yes
a yes2
yes
a period of about 365 days or 12 months, measured from any particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I arrived here two years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我两年前来到这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve known each other for over a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相识一年多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s almost a year since Sue died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休去世快一年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jodi is 15 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约迪15岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-year business plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三年的业务发展计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: a four-year-old child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四岁的孩子

Sense.DEF: a period of 365 or 366 days divided into 12 months beginning on January 1st and ending on December 31st
Sense.EXAMPLE: the year that Kennedy died
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯尼迪去世那一年
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the year 1785

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They moved here at the beginning of this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是今年年初搬来这里的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: last year’s cup final
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年的足总杯决赛

Sense.EXAMPLE: She goes there every year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每年都去那里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum attracts 100,000 visitors a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆每年吸引十万名游客。
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the early years of last century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上世纪初

Subsense.DEF: a very long period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s years since I rode a bike.

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been there for years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已很久没去那里了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the first time in years I’d seen her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是多年来我第一次见到她。

GramExa.PROPFORM: a man/woman/person etc of his/her etc years
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gordon is very active for a man of his years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戈登对于他这个年龄的人来说算是很活跃了。

Sense.DEF: during the whole year
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s warm enough to swim all year round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里很暖和﹐全年都可以游泳。

Sense.DEF: as each year passes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Business has steadily increased year by year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业务逐年稳步增长。

Sense.LEXUNIT: year after year/year in, year out
Sense.DEF: every year for many years
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many birds return to the same spot year after year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多鸟类年年都回到同一个地方。

Sense.DEF: a particular period of time in someone’s life or in history
Sense.TRAN: 〔人生或历史中的〕某一特定时间段﹐时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: the difficult years following the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后的艰难岁月
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheila enjoyed her years as a student in Oxford.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉在牛津大学就读的那几年过得很快乐。

Sense.DEF: the time within a period of 12 months when students are studying at a school or university
a particular level that a student stays at for one year
Sense.EXAMPLE: a group of year seven students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群七年级学生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was in my year at school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和我上同一年级。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in their first etc year at school or university
Sense.TRAN: 一年级/二年级等的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: The department offers a study skills programme for all first years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系里为所有一年级学生开设了学习技巧课程。

Sense.DEF: the musician etc who was voted the best in a particular year
Sense.TRAN: 年度最佳音乐人/运动员/汽车等

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new Renault was voted car of the year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新款雷诺汽车被选为年度最佳汽车。

Sense.DEF: compared with the previous year
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales rose by 39 per cent year on year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额与去年相比增长了39%。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is extremely unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never in a million years did I think we’d lose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝不认为我们会输。

Sense.DEF: a very long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists have been involved in war since the year dot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家从很久以前就已卷入战争。

Sense.LEXUNIT: put years on sb/take years off sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone look or feel older or younger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tina’s divorce has put years on her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚使蒂娜显得老了。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 - MEANING 义项 7

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Little is known about his early years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的早年生活鲜为人知。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He changed his opinion during the last years of his life.
the home in which she spent her childhood years
She worked for the BBC during the war years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在战争年代里，她为英国广播公司工作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when an economy or industry is very successful

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of cases has risen dramatically in recent years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近几年病例数量大幅上升。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In later years he regretted their argument.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在晚年他后悔他们争吵过。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'in ancient years' or 或 'in the ancient years'. Say 而要说 in ancient times or 或 long ago.

Sense.DEF: a book printed once a year, with information about a particular subject or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rothman’s Football Yearbook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《罗思曼足球年鉴》

Sense.DEF: a book printed once a year by a school or college, with information and pictures about what happened there in the past year
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high school yearbook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本中学年刊

Sense.DEF: an animal, especially a young horse, between one and two years old
Sense.TRAN: 〔一两岁的〕小动物﹔〔尤指〕小马驹

Sense.DEF: continuing for a year or all through the year
Sense.TRAN: 持续一年的﹐整整一年的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a year-long study of the problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该问题持续一年的研究

Sense.DEF: happening or appearing every year or once a year
Sense.TRAN: 每年〔发生或出现〕的﹔一年一次[度]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Salary levels are reviewed on a yearly basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工资水平每年都要审查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a total yearly income of $78,000
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7.8万美元的年总收入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a checkup at five-yearly intervals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每五年一次的检查

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The magazine is issued twice yearly two times a year.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志一年发行两期。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hannah yearned for a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜渴望有个孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Phil had yearned to be a pilot from an early age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲尔从小就渴望成为一名飞行员。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say long for sth or long to do sth rather than yearn .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说 long for sth 或 long to do sth﹐而不说 yearn

Sense.DEF: a strong desire for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a yearning for travel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对旅游的渴望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had a deep yearning to return to his home town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他深深地渴望回到故乡。

Sense.DEF: happening or continuing through the whole year
Sense.EXAMPLE: a year-round supply of fresh fruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新鲜水果的全年供应

Sense.DEF: a type of fungus used for producing alcohol in beer and wine, and for making bread rise
a thick sticky brown substance made from yeast, used in cooking or for spreading on bread
an infectious condition that affects the vagina in women
used to say that you think something is very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 呸﹐咦〔用于对某事表示强烈的厌恶〕

Sense.DEF: to shout or say something very loudly, especially because you are frightened, angry, or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因恐惧﹑愤怒或激动而〕叫喊﹐大嚷大叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Help me!’ she yelled hysterically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “救救我！”她歇斯底里地大叫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I yelled out, ‘Here I am!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大声喊道:“我在这儿！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd are on their feet yelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众站着高声呐喊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t you yell at me like that!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这样对我大喊大叫的！

GramExa.PROPFORM: yell at sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They yelled at him to stop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们朝他喊﹐让他停下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Clare yelled in pain as she fell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔跌倒时痛得大叫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He could hear Pete yelling at the top of his voice very loudly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到皮特声嘶力竭地在喊叫。

Sense.DEF: to ask for help
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you need me, just yell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要我时就喊一声。

Sense.DEF: a loud shout

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She let out a yell when she saw me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她见到我大叫了一声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dan gave a yell of delight when Larsson scored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉尔森得分时﹐丹高兴地大叫。

Sense.DEF: words or phrases that students and cheerleaders shout together to show support for their school, college etc
having the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
Sense.EXAMPLE: yellow flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄花

Sense.DEF: an offensive way of describing the skin colour of people from parts of Asia
not brave
the colour of butter or the middle part of an egg
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yellow doesn’t suit me at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄色一点都不适合我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room was decorated in a variety of reds, blues, and yellows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间以深浅不一的红色﹑蓝色和黄色装饰。

Sense.DEF: to become yellow or make something become yellow
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paper had yellowed with age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纸张已年久发黄了。

Sense.DEF: a yellow card held up by a football referee to show that a player has done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球裁判对犯规球员出示的〕黄牌

Sense.DEF: a dangerous tropical disease which makes your skin turn slightly yellow
a small European bird with a yellow head
Sense.TRAN: 黄鹀〔欧洲鸟类﹐体形小﹐头部呈黄色〕

Sense.DEF: slightly yellow
Sense.TRAN: 微黄的﹐有点黄的﹐发黄的
Sense.EXAMPLE: yellowish teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发黄的牙齿

Sense.DEF: a line of yellow paint along the edge of a street in Britain which means you can only park your car for a short time or at particular times
Sense.TRAN: 黄线〔英国街边表示可以临时停车或在某些时段可以停车的线〕

GramExa.GLOSS: two lines of paint that mean you cannot park there at any time
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 双黄线〔表示任何时间都禁止停车〕

Sense.DEF: a book that contains the telephone numbers of businesses and organizations in an area, arranged according to the type of service or goods they provide
Sense.TRAN: 黄页〔按行业或产品分类的企业和机构电话号码簿〕

Sense.DEF: slightly yellow
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cream was thick and yellowy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶油很稠﹐呈淡黄色。

Sense.DEF: a short sharp high cry which a person or an animal makes because they are excited, in pain, surprised etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因兴奋﹑疼痛﹑吃惊等而发出的〕尖叫﹐叫喊

GramExa.PROPFORM: give/let out a yelp of pain/dismay/surprise etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water was hotter than she had expected, and she gave an involuntary yelp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水比她料想的要烫﹐她不由自主地叫了一声。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The dog ran up and down, yelping.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只狗跑来跑去﹐叫个不停。

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Japan: symbol ¥
the value of Japanese money in relation to the money of other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar fell by 24 percent against the yen decreased in value in relation to the yen between 1970 and 1973.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在1970年至1973年间﹐美元对日元的汇率下跌了24%。

Sense.DEF: a strong desire

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a yen for foreign travel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对出国旅行的渴望

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’d always had a yen to write a book.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直渴望写一本书。

Sense.DEF: an officer in the US navy who often works in an office
a farmer in Britain in the past who owned and worked on his own land
the people in Britain in the past who owned and farmed their own land
yes
your or you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep yer mouth shut!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭上你的嘴！

Subsense.DEF: used as an answer to say that something is true or that you agree
Subsense.TRAN: 是﹐对〔表示某事物是真的或表示同意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘It was a great show.’ ‘Yes, it was.’

Subsense.DEF: used as an answer to a question or statement containing a negative, to say that the opposite is true
Subsense.TRAN: 不〔用于回应否定疑问句或否定陈述﹐表示反驳〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sarah isn’t very intelligent, is she?’ ‘Yes, she is in fact, she is intelligent!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “萨拉不是很聪明﹐是吗？”“不﹐她很聪明！”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘There isn’t any cereal left.’ ‘Yes, there is – it’s in the cupboard.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “没有麦片了。”“不﹐还有——在碗橱里。

Sense.DEF: used as an answer to say that you want something or want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 好的﹐是的〔表示想要某物或想要做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like a sandwich?’ ‘Yes, please.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想来个三明治吗？”“好的﹐谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like to come with us?’ ‘Yes, I’d love to.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你想和我们一起去吗？”“好的﹐我很乐意。”

Sense.DEF: used as an answer to say that you will do something, or that someone may do or have something
Sense.TRAN: 好的﹐可以〔表示愿意或允许〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I have a glass of water?’ ‘Yes, of course.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可以给我一杯水吗？”“当然可以。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He proposed to me and I said yes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向我求婚﹐我答应了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with what someone has said, but there is another fact to consider
Sense.TRAN: 是的﹐不过…〔表示同意某人的说法﹐但还有其他因素要考虑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘There are still a lot of problems with Jeff’s proposal.’ ‘Yes, but it’s the best one we have.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “杰夫的方案还有许多问题。”“是的﹐不过这是我们现有的最好方案了。”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you have heard someone or are ready to speak to someone
Sense.TRAN: 〔表示听到某人说话或准备开口〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mike?’ ‘Yes?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “迈克？”“什么事？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes sir, how can I help you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是﹐先生﹐我能为您做些什么？

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are listening to someone and want them to continue
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐噢〔表示正在听﹐并希望说话人继续〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘And so I tried phoning him ...’ ‘Yes ...’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “因此我就试着打电话给他……”“噢……”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very excited or happy about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes! Rivaldo’s scored again!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好！里瓦尔多又得分啦！

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you do not believe what someone is saying
Subsense.TRAN: 真的〔表示不相信某人说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘There’s nothing going on between me and Jane. We’re just good friends.’ ‘Oh yes?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我和简之间什么事也没有﹐我们只是好朋友。”“噢﹐是吗？”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you have remembered something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where’s my umbrella? Oh yes – I left it in the car.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的伞呢？ 噢﹐对了——我把它落在车里了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean what you have just said, even though it is surprising
Sense.TRAN: 是的﹐对的〔用于强调前面说的令人惊讶的事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took ten years – yes, ten whole years – to complete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花了十年才完成——是呀﹐整整十年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yes, you heard me correctly – I said 1921.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对的﹐你没有听错——我是说 1921 年。

Sense.DEF: used to show annoyance when someone is talking to you and you do not want to listen
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘And don’t forget to lock the door!’ ‘Yes, yes, OK.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “还有﹐别忘了锁门！”“好﹐好﹐好的。”

Sense.DEF: used to show that there is not one clear answer to a question
Sense.TRAN: 既是又不是〔表示难以明确答复〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Were you surprised?’ ‘Well, yes and no. I knew they were planning something, but I wasn’t sure what.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得惊讶吗？”“嗯﹐既惊讶又不惊讶。我知道他们在计划着什么﹐但又不确定是什么。

Sense.DEF: a vote, voter, or reply that agrees with an idea, plan, law etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: According to the latest opinion poll, the noes have 60%, and the yeses have 40%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据最新的民意调查﹐反对者占60%﹐赞成者占40%。

Sense.DEF: a school for Jewish students, where they can train to become rabbisreligious leaders
Sense.TRAN: 〔培养拉比的〕犹太神学院﹐犹太高等学校

Sense.DEF: someone who always agrees with and obeys their employer, leader etc in order to gain some advantage – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 唯唯诺诺的人﹐遵命先生﹐应声虫〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: on or during the day before today
Sense.EXAMPLE: What did you do yesterday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天你做了什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna left yeaterday afternoon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜昨天下午离开了。

Sense.DEF: the day before today
Sense.EXAMPLE: yesterday’s meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天的会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: They arrived the day before yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们前天到的。

Sense.DEF: the recent past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the great champions of yesterday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰出的历届冠军

Sense.DEF: information that is old and no longer interesting
existing in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the steam trains of yesteryear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当年的蒸汽火车

Subsense.DEF: used in negative statements and questions to talk about whether something that was expected has happened
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于否定陈述句和疑问句﹐谈论预料中的某事是否已发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t asked him yet but I will.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你做完家庭作业了吗？”“还没有。”

Subsense.DEF: used in negative statements and questions to talk about whether a situation has started to exist
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于否定陈述句和疑问句﹐谈论某情况是否已开始存在〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘How are you going to get there?’ ‘I don’t know yet.’
Women didn’t yet have the vote at that time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时妇女还没有选举权。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In spoken English, yet usually comes at the end of the sentence.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英语口语中﹐yet一般用于句子的末尾
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I haven’t finished my homework yet.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有完成家庭作业。
F2NBox.EXPL: It can also come after ‘don’t/do not’, ‘hasn’t/has not’, ‘isn’t/is not’ etc, or before ‘why’, ‘whether’ etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 它还可以用于don’t/do not﹐hasn’t/has not﹐isn’t/is not等之后﹐或why﹐whether等之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We do not yet have a solution to this problem.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没有找到这个问题的解决办法。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I haven’t decided yet whether to take part in the competition.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没决定是否参加比赛。
F2NBox.EXPL: When a past event is being referred to, yet is usually used with perfect tenses, but it can be used with the simple past tense in informal American English.
F2NBox.TRAN: 说到过去的事件﹐yet一般和完成时连用﹐但是在非正式的美国英语中﹐它可以和一般过去时连用
F2NBox.HEADING: yet, still, already
F2NBox.EXPL: Yet is used to say that something has not happened or a situation has not started to exist, or to ask if something has happened.
F2NBox.TRAN: yet用于表示某事尚未发生或某种情形尚未出现﹐或用于询问某事是否已经发生
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It isn’t time to go yet.
F2NBox.EXPL: Still is used to say that an earlier situation has not changed.
F2NBox.TRAN: still用于表示早前的情形没有变化
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: This system of naming is still used today (NOT 不说 yet used today).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种命名系统今天仍在使用。
F2NBox.EXPL: Already is used to emphasize that something has happened or a situation has started to exist.
F2NBox.TRAN: already用于强调某事已经发生﹐或某种情形已经开始出现
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He has already published two novels.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经发表了两部小说。
F2NBox.EXPL: It is also used in questions to show surprise that something has happened sooner than expected.
F2NBox.TRAN: already也用于疑问句中﹐表示因某事的发生早于预料而感到吃惊

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences to say that someone should not or need not do something now, although they may have to do it later
Sense.TRAN: 现在就〔用于否定句﹐表示某人做某事为时尚早〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t give up yet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还不能放弃！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go yet. I like talking to you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这就走啊﹐我喜欢跟你说话。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is even more than it was before or is in addition to what existed before
Sense.TRAN: 更﹐更甚﹔又〔强调比之前的更多或更进一步〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got a call from the factory, telling of yet more problems.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接到工厂打来的电话﹐说是又有更多问题出现。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inflation had risen to a yet higher level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀又上升到了更高的水平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: yet another reason to be cautious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又一个需要谨慎的理由
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting has been cancelled yet again one more time after many others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议又一次被取消。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is the biggest, worst etc of its kind that has existed up to now
Sense.TRAN: 迄今为止最大的/最糟的等(某物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: This could turn out to be our biggest mistake yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这或许是我们迄今所犯的最大错误。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nordstrom’s latest novel looks like his best yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 努德斯特伦的最新小说看来是他迄今写得最好的一部。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something has not happened up to now
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had no luck as yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐我们还没什么运气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: on an as yet undecided date
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在还未确定的某个日期

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how much time will pass before something happens, or how long a situation will continue
Sense.TRAN: 还要数月/周/年〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When’s your holiday?’ ‘Oh, not for ages yet.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么时候去休假？”“噢﹐不知何年何月呢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It could be months yet before they know their fate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能要好几个月他们才能知道自己的命运。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is still possible in the future, in spite of the way that things seem now
Sense.TRAN: 还是可能会做某事〔表示某事尽管现在似乎没有可能﹐将来还是有可能发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We may win yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是有可能会赢的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plan could yet succeed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划还是有可能会成功。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb/sth has yet to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has not done something, or that something has not happened when you think it should already have been done or have happened
Sense.TRAN: 某人尚未做某事/某事尚未发生〔表示认为该做而未做或该发生而未发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have yet to hear Ray’s version of what happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有听过雷对所发生的事的说法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bank has yet to respond to our letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行尚未给我们回信。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 但是﹐可是﹐然而〔用于在先前说过的内容之后引出令人惊讶的事实情况或品质〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kelly was a convicted criminal, yet many people admired him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯利是个已定罪的犯人﹐然而许多人很钦佩他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She does not speak our language and yet she seems to understand what we say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不会说我们的语言﹐然而她似乎听得懂我们说什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a story that is strange yet true
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个怪诞但却真实的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inexpensive yet effective solution to our problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个花钱不多但能有效解决我们的问题的方法

Sense.DEF: a large hairy creature like a human which some people believe lives in the Himalayan mountains
Sense.TRAN: 雪人〔传说生活在喜马拉雅山脉的一种多毛﹑形如人类的动物

Sense.DEF: a tree with dark green leaves and red berries, or the wood of this tree
men’s underwear which has a part at the front shaped like an upside down Y
Sense.TRAN: 〔前裆部呈倒Y字形的〕男内裤﹐三角短裤

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a Jewish person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 犹太人〔极具冒犯性﹐勿用此词〕

Sense.DEF: a language based on German used by older Jewish people, especially those who are from Eastern Europe
Sense.TRAN: 依地语﹐意第绪语〔尤为东欧的年老犹太人使用的一种语言〕

Sense.DEF: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information
Sense.TRAN: 产生﹐得出〔结果﹑答案或资料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

Sense.DEF: to produce crops, profits etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each of these oilfields could yield billions of barrels of oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些油田每一座都能开采出数十亿桶原油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tourist industry yielded an estimated $2.25 billion for the state last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年旅游业为这个州创造了约22.5亿美元的收入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These investments should yield a reasonable return.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些投资项目应该会有不错的收益。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: high-yielding crops
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高产量的作物

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something produces a result, a profit etc rather than yields it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐产生结果﹑利润等一般都说produce﹐而不说yield
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Each cow produces almost 20 litres of milk a day.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 每头奶牛每天产奶近20升。

Sense.DEF: to allow yourself to be forced or persuaded to do something or stop having something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The military has promised to yield power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军方答应交出权力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hijackers refuse to yield to demands to release the passengers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 劫持者拒不答应释放乘客的要求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Further action may be necessary if the leaders do not yield to diplomatic pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果领导人没有屈服于外交压力﹐可能有必要采取进一步的行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally she yielded to temptation and helped herself to a large slice of cake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后她经不住诱惑﹐吃了一大块蛋糕。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say someone gives in to pressures, demands etc rather than yields to them.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐屈服于压力﹑同意要求等一般都说give in to﹐而不说yield to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I very much doubt the boss will give in to her demands.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常怀疑老板是否会答应她的要求。

Sense.DEF: to allow other traffic on a bigger road to go first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yield to traffic on the left
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 左侧车辆先行。

Sense.DEF: to move, bend, or break because of physical force or pressure
Sense.TRAN: 〔因外力作用或受压而〕移动﹐弯曲﹐断裂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ideally, the surface should yield slightly under pressure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理论上﹐物体表面在受力时应该会轻微凹陷。

Sense.DEF: to stop fighting and accept defeat
if one thing yields to another, it is replaced by that thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laughter quickly yielded to amazement as the show went on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着节目进行下去﹐笑声很快平息﹐取而代之的是惊叹声。

Sense.DEF: to show or produce something that was hidden or difficult to find, or that people did not know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: New research has yielded up some surprising discoveries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的研究揭示了一些令人惊奇的发现。

Sense.DEF: to give something that belongs to you to someone else, because you are forced to
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would never yield up the castle to the English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝不会把城堡让给英格兰人。

Sense.DEF: the amount of profits, crops etc that something produces
Sense.EXAMPLE: The average milk yield per cow has doubled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每头奶牛的平均产奶量翻了一番。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shareholders are expecting a higher yield this year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 股民们期盼今年会有更高的收益。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a yield of over six percent
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过6%的收益

Sense.DEF: a surface that is yielding is soft and will move or bend when you press it
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体表面〕易变形的﹐易弯曲的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the yielding softness of the bed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张床的柔软度

Sense.DEF: willing to agree with other people’s wishes
said when something frightens or shocks you
the female principle in Chinese philosophy which is inactive, dark, and negative, and which combines with yangthe male principle to influence everything in the world
the ancient Chinese philosophy which is based on the idea that everything in the universe is formed and influenced by the combination of two forces called yin and yang
Sense.TRAN: 〔中国古代哲学概念中的〕阴阳

Sense.DEF: used when you are very pleased or excited about something
Sense.TRAN: 好啊〔表示非常满意或兴奋的欢呼声〕

Sense.DEF: a small boat with sails, used for racing
used to greet someone, to get their attention, or as a reply when someone says your name
Sense.TRAN: 唷〔用于打招呼﹑引起注意或回应别人的呼唤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yo, dude! How’s it going?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唷﹐老兄！过得怎样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Darren?’ ‘Yo!’

Sense.DEF: a rude noisy and sometimes violent young man
Sense.TRAN: 野小子﹐粗鲁吵闹的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: drunken yobbos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝醉的野小子

Sense.DEF: to sing while changing between your natural voice and a very high voice, traditionally done in the mountains of countries such as Switzerland and Austria
Sense.TRAN: 用约德尔调唱(歌)〔瑞士﹑奥地利等国山区居民用真假嗓音互换的唱法〕

Sense.DEF: a song or sound made by yodelling
a system of exercises that help you control your mind and body in order to relax
Sense.TRAN: 瑜伽〔控制身心以达到放松状态的一种锻炼方法〕

Sense.DEF: a Hindu philosophy in which you learn exercises to control your mind and body in order to try to become closer to God
a thick liquid food that tastes slightly sour and is made from milk, or an amount of this food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pot of strawberry yogurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐草莓酸奶

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lot of knowledge about yoga, and who often teaches it to other people
another spelling of yoghurt
a wooden bar used for keeping two animals together, especially cattle, when they are pulling heavy loads
a frame that you put across your shoulders so that you can carry two equal loads which hang from either side of it
something that restricts your freedom, making life difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: the yoke of tradition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的枷锁

Sense.DEF: a part of a skirt or shirt just below the waist or collar, from which the main piece of material hangs in folds
to put a yoke on two animals
Sense.TRAN: 用轭把〔牲口〕套在一起﹐给…上轭

Sense.DEF: to closely connect two ideas, people, or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beauty is forever yoked to youth in our culture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我们的文化中﹐美丽总是和青春分不开。

Sense.DEF: someone who comes from the countryside, seems stupid, and does not know much about modern life, ideas etc – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 乡巴佬﹐土包子〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the yellow part in the centre of an egg
a Jewish religious holiday on which people do not eat, but pray to be forgiven for the things they have done wrong
Sense.TRAN: 赎罪日〔犹太教节日﹐教徒于此日禁食并作忏悔祈祷〕

Sense.DEF: over there – used to show or explain where something or someone is
Sense.EXAMPLE: the fresh blooms on yonder tree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那边树上初放的花

Sense.DEF: a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s yonks since we had a good night out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们好久没有在晚上出去好好玩了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went to Blackpool once, yonks ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去过布莱克浦一次﹐那是很久以前了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We haven’t seen Tom and Jean for yonks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很久没见到汤姆和琼了。

Sense.DEF: relating to or intended for young people – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: a yoof magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本青年杂志

Sense.DEF: young people, considered as a group – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 青年﹐青年人〔总称﹐幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: British white yoof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的白人青年

Sense.DEF: used to attract someone’s attention when they are a long way from you
Sense.TRAN: 喂〔用于引起相距较远者的注意〕

Sense.DEF: existing a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: in days of yore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昔日

Sense.DEF: a food made from flour, eggs, and milk, baked and eaten with meat in Britain
a type of dog that is very small and has long brown hair
Sense.TRAN: 约克郡㹴犬〔一种小型犬﹐长有棕色长毛〕

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person or group of people when speaking or writing to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hi, Kelly. How are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗨﹐凯利﹐你好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must all listen carefully.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们大家都必须仔细听着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have some news for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一些消息要告诉你们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The letter is addressed to both of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信是寄给你们俩的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did Robin give you the money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗宾把钱给你了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only you can make this decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有你才能作这个决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You idiot!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个白痴！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You boys have got to learn to behave yourselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们这些男孩子必须学着规矩点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey, you over there! Get out of the way!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘿﹐说你呢﹐让开！

Sense.DEF: people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to be 21 or over to buy alcohol in Florida.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在佛罗里达﹐必须年满21岁才能买酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can never be sure what Emily is thinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你永远摸不透埃米莉在想什么。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘you had’
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’d been more careful, this wouldn’t have happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你多加小心﹐这事就不会发生了。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘you would’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d be amazed at how much she spends on clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是知道她花多少钱购置服装﹐一定会大吃一惊。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘you will’ or 或 ‘you shall’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll feel better soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你很快就会感觉好些的。

Sense.DEF: a young person, plant, or animal has not lived for very long
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s younger than me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他比我小。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re too young to get married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还太小﹐不能结婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: young trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小树
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I was young, I wanted to be a model.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年轻时候想当模特。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was a great footballer in his younger dayswhen he was younger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰年轻时是个很棒的足球运动员。

Sense.DEF: a young country, organization, or type of science has existed for only a short time
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑组织或学科〕新成立的﹐新兴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At that time, America was still a young nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时﹐美国还是个年轻的国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Psychology is a young science.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理学是一门新兴科学。

Sense.DEF: used to speak to a girl or boy when you are angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 小姐/年轻人〔生气时用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, you listen to me, young man!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在﹐你听我说﹐年轻人！

Sense.DEF: seeming or looking younger than you are
Sense.TRAN: 显年轻的﹐比实际年龄显小的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Val is incredibly young for her age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对于她的年龄﹐瓦尔看上去非常年轻。

Sense.DEF: thinking and behaving as if you were young, even though you are old
used humorously to give the age of an old person who seems or feels much younger
Sense.TRAN: 65/82/97等岁〔幽默说法﹐表示老人显得或感觉非常年轻〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next week, Bessie will be 84 years young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个星期﹐贝茜就“芳龄” 84了。

Sense.DEF: designed or intended for young people
Sense.TRAN: 专为年轻人设计的﹐面向年轻人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m looking for something in a younger style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找式样年轻一些的。

Sense.DEF: a young person who has just started doing a job or being involved in something, and is eager to achieve things or make changes
Sense.TRAN: 态度积极的新人﹐积极求变的新人

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb is not getting any younger
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is no longer young, especially when they may soon be too old to do something
Sense.TRAN: 某人已不再年轻〔尤指他们可能不久就干不了某事〕

Exponent.EXAMPLE: My dad died when I was young.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸在我年龄很小时就去世了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Young people are often unable to get jobs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人常常找不到工作。

Exponent.DEF: a small child is very young. Little sounds more informal than small, and is used especially in spoken English.
Exponent.TRAN: 年幼的﹐幼小的〔little没有small正式﹐尤用于英语口语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有两个年幼的孩子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We used to go camping a lot when the kids were little.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前孩子们还小的时候我们经常去露营。

Exponent.DEF: at the age when you change from being a child into an adult – used especially when talking about the problems that young people have at this age
Exponent.TRAN: 青春期的〔尤用于谈论青春期孩子的问题〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sudden mood changes are common in adolescent girls.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 青春期女孩子情绪波动大是很常见的。

Exponent.DEF: connected with young people who commit crime
Exponent.TRAN: 青少年的﹐少年的〔用来指称犯罪的青少年〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a special prison for juvenile offenders

Exponent.DEF: seeming young, or typical of someone who is young – often used about someone who is no longer young
Exponent.TRAN: 看上去年轻的﹔年轻人的〔常用于描述不再年轻的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个看上去很年轻的55岁的人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Andrew still has a slim youthful look about him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁依然保持着修长的身材和年轻人的模样。

Sense.DEF: young people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The young are easily misled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人容易被误导。

Sense.DEF: a group of young animals that belong to a particular mother or type of animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lioness fought to protect her young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那头母狮为保护幼狮而搏斗。

Sense.DEF: someone famous who lived in the past and had the same name as their mother or father
Sense.TRAN: 小…〔用于称呼与母亲或父亲同名的旧时名人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: William Pitt the Younger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小威廉·皮特

Sense.DEF: a criminal in Britain who is not an adult according to the law
a child or young person
used when speaking or writing to one or more people to show that something belongs to them or is connected with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you move your car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把你的车挪一下吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is that your brother over there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那边的是你弟弟吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry. It’s not your fault.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐这不是你的错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be aware of your own feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要注意自己的情绪。

Sense.DEF: of or belonging to any person
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you are facing north, east is on your right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你面向北﹐你的右边就是东。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning something that is a typical example of a particular type of thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于提及某类事物的典型例子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was just your basic, ordinary hotel room – nothing special.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是那种最基本﹑最普通的酒店客房没什么特别之处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your typical 60s pop group had three guitarists and a drummer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60年代典型的流行乐队有三个吉他手和一个鼓手。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘you are’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你迟到了。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking or writing to one or more people to refer to something that belongs to them or is connected with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is our room, and yours is just across the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我们的房间﹐你们的在走廊那边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people have money problems, but yours are more serious than most people’s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人有财务问题﹐不过你的问题比大多数人的要严重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A cash prize of £10,000 or a new car – the choice is yours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一万英镑的奖金或一辆新车——随你选择。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is Maria a friend of yours?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚是你的朋友吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: That bag of yours weighs a ton.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的这个包重得不得了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve read that book of yours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看过你的那本书了。

Sense.DEF: if something desirable is yours for the taking or asking, you can easily obtain it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you want the job, it’s yours for the asking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想要这份工作﹐开口说一声就是了。

Sense.DEF: used to end a formal letter that begins ‘Dear Sir’ or ‘Dear Madam’
Sense.TRAN: 您忠诚的〔用于以Dear Sir或Dear Madam开头的正式信函的末尾〕

Sense.DEF: used to end a letter that begins with the title and name of the person you are writing to, for example ‘Dear Mr. Graves’
Sense.TRAN: 你真挚的〔用于以头衔加姓氏称呼收信人的信函末尾〕

Sense.DEF: used humorously to mean ‘I’ or ‘me’
Sense.EXAMPLE: They all went out, leaving yours truly to clear up the mess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都出去了﹐留下本人收拾残局。

Sense.DEF: used when talking to someone to show that they are affected by their own action
Sense.TRAN: 你自己﹔您自己﹔你们自己
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at yourself in the mirror.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照照镜子吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come and warm yourselves by the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到火边来暖暖身子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you hurt yourself?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你伤到自己了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go and buy yourself an ice cream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去给你自己买个冰激凌吧。

Subsense.TRAN: 你自己﹐你本人〔用以加强语气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t trust me, you’d better go yourself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果不相信我﹐最好自己去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You yourselves are the guilty ones.
It must be true. You told me so yourself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定是这样﹐你自己亲口对我这样说的。

Subsense.DEF: used after ‘like’, ‘as’, or ‘except’ instead of ‘you’, especially to make what you are saying seem more formal or important
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于like﹐as或except之后代替you﹐以使所说之事显得更正式或更重要〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Most of our customers are people like yourself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的大多数客户都像您一样。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can’t go home by yourself in the dark.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天黑了﹐你不能一个人回家。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you think you can move the sofa by yourself?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得你自己一个人搬得动沙发吗？

Sense.DEF: to not feel or behave as you usually do, for example because you are upset or ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you all right? You don’t seem yourself this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没事吧？今天早上你好像状态不好。

Sense.DEF: if you have something to yourself, you do not have to share it with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going out, so you’ll have the place to yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要出去﹐这地方就归你一个人了。

Sense.DEF: the period of time when someone is young, especially the period when someone is a teenager
Sense.TRAN: 青年时期﹔〔尤指〕青少年时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of these people had used drugs in their youth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人中有许多人年轻时曾吸过毒。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say when I was young, rather than saying in my youth.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般都说 when I was young﹐而不说 in my youth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They were friends when they were young.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们年轻的时候是朋友。

Sense.DEF: a teenage boy – used especially in newspapers to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 少年﹐小伙子〔尤用于报纸上﹐含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gang of youths
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一伙少年

Sense.DEF: young people in general

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The youth of today are the pensioners of tomorrow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的年轻人就是明天领养老金的人。

Sense.DEF: the quality or state of being young
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite his youth, he had travelled alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他虽然年纪还小﹐却已独自旅行过了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cream will restore youth and vitality to your skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款乳霜可以让你的肌肤恢复青春与活力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She spent her youth in India.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在印度度过她的青年时代。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do things you did when young, to try and experience youth again
spent doing things that were bad or not useful
the time long ago when you were young

Collocate.COLLOC: the days/dreams/friends etc of sb’s youth
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的青春时光/青春梦想/年轻时的朋友等

Sense.DEF: a meeting place for young people where they can have drinks, play games etc
the interests and activities of young people, especially the music, films etc they enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 青年文化〔尤指年轻人喜欢的音乐﹑电影等〕

Sense.DEF: typical of young people, or seeming young
Sense.TRAN: 年轻人的﹐青年的﹔显得年轻的

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 年轻人的热情/精力/活力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has managed to maintain her youthful appearance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她保持了年轻的外貌。

Sense.DEF: young
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photo shows a smiling, youthful Burgos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片上是一个面带微笑﹑青春洋溢的布尔戈斯。

Sense.DEF: a place where people, especially young people who are travelling, can stay very cheaply for a short time
the activity of staying in youth hostels and walking or cycling between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went youth hostelling in the Peak District.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到山峰区寄宿青年旅舍旅行。

Sense.DEF: a website, started in 2005, where users can upload, watch, and share video clips
Sense.TRAN: YouTube视频网站〔用户可以上传﹑观看和分享视频短片的网站﹐创始于2005年〕
the short form of 缩略式= ‘you have’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve broken it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把它打破了。

Sense.DEF: if an animal or a person yowls, they make a long loud cry, especially because they are unhappy or in pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因悲痛或疼痛而〕嚎叫﹐惨叫
Sense.EXAMPLE: A tomcat was yowling out on the lawn.

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=year年

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in China
a desert plant with long pointed leaves on a thick straight stem
used to show that you think something is very unpleasant

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant

Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was yucky.

Sense.DEF: another spelling of yuck
Christmas
a logthick piece of wood that some people burn as a tradition on the evening before Christmas

Sense.DEF: a chocolate cake shaped like a log and eaten at Christmas
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞原木形巧克力蛋糕

Sense.DEF: Christmas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yuletide festivities

Sense.DEF: said when you think something tastes very good
tasting very good

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Treacle tart! Yummy!’ said Simon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “糖蜜馅饼！ 好吃！”西蒙说。

Sense.DEF: a young mother who looks attractive and fashionable
Sense.TRAN: 时尚辣妈﹐俏妈咪〔指年轻时髦的漂亮妈妈〕

Sense.DEF: a young person with a professional job who seems to be interested only in earning a lot of money and buying expensive things
Sense.TRAN: 雅皮士〔指似乎只关心赚钱﹑买奢侈品的职业青年〕

Sense.DEF: to improve the buildings in an area, or to open expensive restaurants, shops etc so that yuppies will want to live in the buildings or use the restaurants etc
Sense.TRAN: 使雅皮士化﹔使适合雅皮士﹐为迎合雅皮士而设

Sense.DEF: a round tent used by nomadspeople who travel rather than living in one place in central Asia
the 26th and last letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第二十六个字母

Sense.DEF: to sleep
crazy or unusual in a way that is amusing
Sense.EXAMPLE: zany comedian Vic Reeves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搞怪喜剧演员维克·里夫斯

Sense.DEF: to quickly attack or destroy something, especially using a beam of electricity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors have tried zapping tumors with high-voltage radiation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生试过用高压辐射消除肿瘤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The laser weapons are designed to zap enemy missiles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些激光武器是用来摧毁敌军导弹的。

Sense.DEF: to change channels on a television by using a remote control
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave just sat there, zapping through all the channels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫就坐在那里不停地换频道。

Sense.DEF: to cook something in a microwave11
to send information quickly from one computer to another
Sense.TRAN: 〔在计算机之间〕快速传递〔信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computers identify threats and zap the results back to US pilots in the war zone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机识别出威胁后立刻把结果传回给战区的美军飞行员。

Sense.DEF: a thing you use for changing channels on a television from a distance
a piece of electrical equipment that attracts and kills insects
eagerness to do something, especially to achieve a particular religious or political aim
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指实现宗教或政治目标的〕热情﹐热忱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He approached the job with missionary zeal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以极大的热忱对待这份工作。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in your zeal to do sth

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方抓捕毒贩心切﹐却忽略了市民基本的公民权利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: their zeal for privatization
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对私有化的热情

Sense.DEF: someone who has extremely strong beliefs, especially religious or political beliefs, and is too eager to make other people share them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指宗教或政治信仰方面的〕热心者﹐狂热者
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious zealots

Sense.DEF: someone who is zealous does or supports something with great energy

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热心的讲道者
Sense.EXAMPLE: zealous political activists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极的政治活动家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one was more zealous than Neil in supporting the proposal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人比尼尔更热心地支持这项提议。

Sense.DEF: an animal that looks like a horse but has black and white lines all over its body
a place marked with black and white lines where people who are walking can cross a road safely

Sense.TRAN: 字母z〔表明其读音的写法〕

Sense.DEF: the general spirit or feeling of a period in history, as shown by people’s ideas and beliefs at the time
a kind of Buddhism from Japan that emphasizes meditation
Sense.TRAN: 禅宗〔日本佛教宗派﹐强调冥想〕

Sense.DEF: the most successful point in the development of something

GramExa.PROPFORM: reach its zenith/be at its zenith
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Roman Empire reached its zenith around the year 100.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公元100年左右罗马帝国达到鼎盛。

Sense.DEF: the highest point that is reached by the sun or the moon in the sky
Sense.TRAN: 天顶〔太阳或月亮在天空中达到的最高点〕

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Zenith sounds rather literary. In everyday English, people usually say peak.
F2NBox.TRAN: zenith听上去比较有文学色彩。在日常英语中﹐人们一般说peak
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Her career was at its peak.

Sense.DEF: a soft gentle wind
a German airship used in World War I
Sense.TRAN: 齐柏林飞艇〔第一次世界大战时使用的德国飞艇〕

Sense.DEF: the number 0

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设x大于或等于零。

Sense.DEF: the point between + and - on a scale for measuring something, or the lowest point on a scale that shows how much there is left of something

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油表已到零位了。

Sense.DEF: a temperature of 0˚ on the Celsius or Fahrenheit scale

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was five degrees below zero last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚零下五度。

Sense.DEF: none at all, or the lowest possible amount

GramExa.GLOSS: they have no chance of success
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike’s chances of winning are virtually zero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克获胜的机会几乎为零。

Sense.EXAMPLE: From 1971 to 1976 West Vancouver experienced zero population growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1971年至1976年﹐西温哥华经历了人口零增长。

Sense.DEF: to direct all your attention towards a particular person or thing

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她立即全力攻击他论据中的薄弱环节。

Sense.DEF: to aim a gun or other weapon towards something or someone
made or acting in a way that produces only a small amount of carbon dioxide, which is offsetbalanced by doing things that remove carbon dioxide from the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: a zero carbon house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零碳住宅

Sense.DEF: the time when a military operation or an important event is planned to begin
Sense.TRAN: 零时﹐进攻发动时刻﹐行动开始时刻

Sense.DEF: eager interest and enjoyment

Sense.DEF: nothing at all

GramExa.EXAMPLE: zillions of mosquitoes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数只蚊子

Sense.DEF: a type of metal frame that people use to help them walk if they are old or ill

PIC.HEADING: ZIMMER FRAME BrE【英】/WALKER AmE【美】捷迈助行架

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your zip’s undone at the back.

Sense.DEF: speed, energy, or excitement

Sense.DEF: nothing at all or zero

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们10比0赢了他们。

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你还剩多少钱？”“一分都没剩！”

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个睡袋可以用拉链拉起来合成一个双人睡袋。

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正在把一只棕色小手提箱的拉链拉上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dress zipped up at the front.

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you zip me up fasten my dress please? I can’t reach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮我把拉链拉上好吗？我够不着。

Sense.DEF: a number that you write at the end of an address on an envolope, package etc. The zip code shows the exact area where someone lives and helps the post office deliver the post more quickly.
a computer file that has been made smaller so that it is easier to store and move
two lines of small metal or plastic pieces that slide together to fasten a piece of clothing
nothing at all or zero
fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: a zippy little sports car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆疾驰的小跑车

Sense.DEF: exciting
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magazine with a zippy title
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名字吸引人的杂志

Sense.DEF: a thin piece of plastic that is used to fasten things together
to fasten something together with a zip tie
a pimple

a musical instrument from Eastern Europe that consists of a flat box with strings stretched across it. You play it by pulling the strings with your fingers or a plectrumsmall piece of plastic, metal etc.
Sense.TRAN: 齐特琴〔东欧的一种弦乐器﹐用手指或拨子弹奏〕

Sense.DEF: not very famous, or famous without having achieved anything – used to show disapproval

Sense.EXAMPLE: pop stars’ daughters and other Z-list celebrities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行歌星的女儿以及其他三流名人

Sense.DEF: someone who appears on television, in magazines etc but is not very famous, or is famous without having achieved anything – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 末流名人﹐不入流的名人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can only get Z-listers to appear on his show nowadays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在只能找些末流名人来上他的节目。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary area through which the sun, moon, and planets appear to travel, which some people believe influences our lives
Sense.TRAN: 黄道带〔指太阳﹑月亮及行星所行经区域构成的假想带〕

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the 12 parts that this area is divided into
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Which sign of the zodiac were you born under?’ ‘Leo.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你属于哪个星座？”“狮子座。”

Sense.DEF: someone who moves very slowly and does not seem to be thinking about what they are doing, especially because they are very tired
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因极度疲劳而〕行动迟缓的人﹐无精打采的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked around like a zombie for most of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天大部分时间里走到哪儿都无精打采的。

Sense.DEF: a dead person whose body is made to move by magic, according to some African and Caribbean religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔非洲和加勒比地区一些宗教中的〕还魂尸﹐僵尸﹐行尸

Sense.DEF: a computer that someone has secretly gained control of and uses to do things such as send spamunwanted emails sent to a large number of people
Sense.TRAN: 僵尸（计算机）〔被某人暗中控制用来滥发垃圾邮件等的计算机〕

Sense.DEF: relating to or arranged in zones
Sense.TRAN: 区域性的﹔分成区的﹔划好范围的

Sense.DEF: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way
Sense.TRAN: 〔有别于周围的〕地区﹐地带﹐区域
Sense.EXAMPLE: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧金山和东京都位于地震带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府设立了一个经济特区来推动私营企业的发展。

Sense.DEF: having all your attention on what you are doing, especially playing a sport, and doing it well
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在运动时〕集中精力的﹐处于良好状态的
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I’m in the zone, every shot seems easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我状态好的时候﹐好像每一次射门都很容易。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Civilians were told to leave the danger zone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 平民被告知离开危险区域。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Planes were diverted to avoid flying over the war zone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机改道绕行﹐避免飞经战区。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: where earthquakes are quite likely to happen
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s not advisable to build nuclear reactors in an earthquake zone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地震带建核反应堆不是明智之举。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The damage is so serious that the government has declared the city a disaster zone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏非常严重﹐政府已宣布该市为灾区。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: where vehicles’ speed is limited to 20 mph, 30 mph etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 时速20英里/30 英里等限速区

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: where soldiers and military activities are not allowed
where nuclear weapons, smoking etc is not allowed

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government intends to set up an enterprise zone in the region.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府打算在该地区设立一个企业振兴区。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He didn’t see the sign saying he’d entered a 20 mph zone.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有看到标志标明他已进入时速20英里的限速区。

Sense.DEF: if an area of land is zoned, it is officially kept separate from other land so that it can be used for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 将…划作〔某项用途的〕区域
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land is currently zoned for residential use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地目前被划为住宅用地。

Sense.DEF: to stop paying attention because you are bored or tired, or because you have taken drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔因厌倦或疲倦而〕走神﹔〔吸毒后〕精神恍惚
Sense.EXAMPLE: What? Oh, sorry – I was just zoning out there for a minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么？哦﹐对不起——我刚才走神了一会儿。

Sense.DEF: unable to think clearly and quickly, especially because you are tired or have taken drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因疲倦或吸毒而〕思维迟钝的﹐精神恍惚的

Sense.DEF: a system of choosing areas to be developed for particular purposes, such as houses or shops, when planning a town
very tired or suffering from the effects of drugs, so that you do not want to do anything
Sense.TRAN: 筋疲力尽的﹔〔因吸毒而〕精神恍惚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m really zonked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我实在是筋疲力尽了。

Sense.DEF: a place, usually in a city, where animals of many kinds are kept so that people can go to look at them
someone who looks after animals in a zoo
a zoo
a scientist who studies animals and their behaviour
the scientific study of animals and their behaviour
to go somewhere or do something very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brenda jumped in the car and zoomed off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦达跳上汽车﹐疾驰而去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The work was really easy and I was able to zoom through it in a couple of hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作容易得很﹐我两三个小时就干完了。

Sense.DEF: to increase suddenly and quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Inflation zoomed to 123%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀激增到123%。

Sense.DEF: if a camera zooms in, it makes the person or thing that you are taking a picture of seem bigger and closer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The camera zoomed in on the child’s face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄像机将孩子的脸拉近了。

Sense.DEF: if a camera zooms out, it makes the person or thing that you are taking a picture of seem smaller and further away
a sound made by a vehicle that is travelling fast
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆快速行驶时发出的〕隆隆声﹐嗡嗡声

Sense.DEF: a camera lens that can change from a distant to a close view
Sense.TRAN: 可变焦距透镜﹐变焦镜头

Sense.DEF: a suit that consists of wide trousers and a jacket with wide shoulders, worn especially in the 1940s and 1950s
Sense.TRAN: 佐特装〔宽大裤子配宽肩夹克的服装﹐尤流行于20世纪40和50年代〕

Sense.DEF: a long vegetable with a dark green skin
Sense.TRAN: 小胡瓜，（绿皮）密生西葫芦

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to a race of black people who live in South Africa
the language used by the Zulu people
a type of hard dry bread, often given to babies
